revised_title: Researches on the Poison-Apparatus in the Actiniadae: A Study of Cnidocytes
tldr: This study by Philip Henry Gosse examines the cnidocytes, or stinging cells, in Actiniadae marine animals. He describes the different types of cnidocytes, their structures, and how they function in defense and predation. Gosse also discusses the possible presence of a venomous fluid within the cnidocytes and its effects on other organisms.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Marine Biology
